centralQuestion: Should Maine phase out lobstering quotas to avoid long term damage to the fishing industry?

reasons.description: Quotas concentrate access in the hands of large or foreign-controlled firms, marginalizing small-scale fishers and coastal communities.

sources.title: The Guardian: 'More than two fifths of English fishing quotas 'held by foreign businesses''

reasons.description: Quota systems have created incentives for discarding and misreporting, leading to waste and ecological harm.

sources.title: The Guardian: 'UK trawlers ignoring ban on discarding edible fish at sea'
Reuters: 'EU seals reform deal to replenish fish stocks'

reasons.description: Annual quota bargaining has prioritized short-term economic interests over science, risking stock health and long-term industry stability.

sources.title: Reuters: 'EU seals reform deal to replenish fish stocks'

objections.description: Scientifically set quotas and tradable quota systems can rebuild stocks, cut waste, and improve long-term economic performance.

sources.title: OECD: 'Sustaining Iceland's fisheries through tradeable quotas'
Resources for the Future: 'Fishing Quota Markets'

objections.description: Following scientific advice when setting quotas has been linked with stock rebuilding and reduced discards.

sources.title: Reuters: 'EU seals reform deal to replenish fish stocks'

objections.description: Regulators argue that tighter limits (e.g., increased minimum size) are needed amid declines in juvenile lobster, and loosening or removing limits would risk overfishing.

sources.title: Associated Press: 'Plan for stricter lobster fishing rules delayed as species shows decline in babies'
Associated Press: 'Plan for stricter lobster fishing rules scrapped amid strong opposition from lobstermen'

research.title: PNAS: 'The distributional outcomes of rights-based management in fisheries'
research.description: Analyzes U.S. catch share (quota) programs and finds increased vessel productivity with nuanced distributional effects, informing debates about consolidation and equity in quota systems.

research.title: ICES Journal of Marine Science: 'Decision rules for quota setting to support spatial management in a lobster fishery'
research.description: Develops and evaluates quota-setting decision rules tailored to a lobster fishery (Jasus edwardsii), highlighting spatial considerations for sustainable management.

research.title: PNAS: 'Impact of catch shares on diversification of fishers’ income and risk'
research.description: Examines how catch share (quota) programs affect income diversification and risk exposure across multiple U.S. fisheries, with implications for economic resilience.

research.title: ICES Journal of Marine Science: 'Fleet-wide stability masks change in the Maine lobster fishery'
research.description: Uses recent data to show shifting intra-fleet dynamics in Maine’s lobster fishery despite apparent aggregate stability, relevant to management choices under change.
